p3System.interfaces

Interface IP2System

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IP3System
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    P3System

    public interface IP2System
    This interface represents the P2 Memory System
    Author:
    samus250

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • registerObjectDataType

        void registerObjectDataType(ObjectDataType type)
                     throws DataTypeExistsException
        Registers an ObjectDataType properly defined into the system.
        Parameters:
        type - the new data type
        Throws:
        DataTypeExistsException - whenever the datatype name clashes with an existing datatype.

      • registerVariable

        void registerVariable(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String type)
               throws InvalidNameException,
                      VariableNameExistsException,
                      InvalidDataTypeException,
                      UnsuccessfulRegistrationException
        Registers a variable in the "general scope" of the system. If valid, the variable will be added to the list of variables (varsList). A memory area in the memory is also reserved for the variable.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable to register
        type - the data type of the variable to register
        Throws:
        InvalidNameException - whenever the name given does not comply with the specified rules for identifiers.
        VariableNameExistsException - whenever the name is valid, but already exists in general scope.
        InvalidDataTypeException - when the name is valid and there is no scope conflict, but the data type specified does not exist.
        UnsuccessfulRegistrationException - whenever the declaration is valid, but no memory block of the required size is available (free) in memory

      • getVariableValue

        java.lang.String getVariableValue(java.lang.String vName)
                           throws VariableDoesNotExistException
        Gets the current value stored at the memory area currently assigned to a variable in the current general scope in the system.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the variable to consider
        Returns:
        a String object formed by the current value in memory, converted to String
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if v is not a variable in the general scopre

      • setVariableValue

        void setVariableValue(java.lang.String vName,
                      java.lang.String value)
               throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                      InvalidValueException
        Assigns a value to a variable. Stores it in the memory area associated to the variable, converted as needed.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the variable to consider
        value - the value, given as a String object
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if v is not a variable in the general scope
        InvalidValueException - if the attempted value does not match the particular data type of v

      • getInstanceFieldValue

        java.lang.String getInstanceFieldValue(java.lang.String vName,
                                       java.lang.String fName)
                                throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                                       NotReferenceVariableException,
                                       InvalidFieldNameException
        Gets the value stored in the corresponding memory area for a particular instance field of a given object
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the variable to consider
        fName - the name of the field whose value is requested
        Returns:
        a String object formed by the current value in memory, converted to String
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if v is not a variable in the general scopre
        NotReferenceVariableException - if the given variable is not a reference variable
        InvalidFieldNameException - if the given name does not match any of the instance fields in the particular object type.

      • setInstanceFieldValue

        void setInstanceFieldValue(java.lang.String vName,
                           java.lang.String fName,
                           java.lang.String value)
                    throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                           NotReferenceVariableException,
                           InvalidFieldNameException,
                           InvalidValueException
        Assigns a given value to a particular instance field in a given object. Stores in the corresponding memory area, converted as needed
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the variable to consider
        fName - the name of the field whose value is requested.
        value - the value, given as a String object
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if no registered variable has name vName
        NotReferenceVariableException - if the given variable is not a reference variable
        InvalidFieldNameException - if the given name does not match any of the instance fields in the particular object type.
        InvalidValueException - if the attempted value does not match the particular instance field

      • createObject

        int createObject(java.lang.String ot)
        Reserves space in memory corresponding to a particular object data type. A block of memory is reserved whose size is the sum of the sizes of its instance fields.
        Parameters:
        ot - the object data type.
        Returns:
        the address of the memory area reserved. If the space requested cannot be reserved, then it returns -1

      • deletePrimitiveDTVariable

        void deletePrimitiveDTVariable(java.lang.String vName)
                        throws VariableDoesNotExistException,
                               NonPrimitiveDataTypeException
        Deletes a given variable from the system and realeases the memory area it occupies.
        Parameters:
        vName - the name of the variable to delete.
        Throws:
        VariableDoesNotExistException - if no registered variable has name vName
        NonPrimitiveDataTypeException - if a variable with he given name exists but is not of primitive type (int, char, or boolean).
